teaching.topicContent: Share objects in more complex situations among friends.
Continue exploring fractions beyond thirds.
Deepen understanding of comparing fractions.Learn strategies to compare fractions with different denominators.
Solve word problems involving fractions.Apply fraction skills to real-life situations.
Operations with Mixed Fractions. Learn how to perform addition and subtraction with mixed fractions.
Become proficient in identifying and working with equivalent fractions.
Adding Mixed Fractions. Understand how to add mixed fractions.
Deepening Equivalent Fractions Understanding. Explore equivalent fractions in more detail.
Learn how to estimate fractions in practical situations.Use estimation skills to make sense of fraction quantities.
Adding Fractions with Unlike Denominators. Learn how to add fractions with different denominators.
Subtracting Mixed Fractions,Learn how to subtract mixed fractions.
Solve division problems involving fractions.Understand how fractions relate to division.
Explore how to multiply fractions.Practice multiplying fractions by whole numbers.
Understand how fractions can be used in measurements. Learn how fractions represent parts of a whole measurement.
Dividing Whole Numbers by Fractions. Learn how to divide whole numbers by fractions.
Tackle more complex fraction challenges. Apply multiple fraction concepts to solve intricate problems.
Writing Fraction Equations. Express fraction relationships as equations.
Learn how to subtract fractions with the same denominators.
Converting Fractions to Decimals. Learn how to convert fractions to decimals.
Explore how fractions relate to percentages.Learn to convert fractions to percentages.

test.description: Put your Fractions knowledge to the test.

questions.content: If you have a pizza divided into 8 slices and you eat 3 slices, what fraction of the pizza did you eat?
Which of the following fractions is greater: 5/12 or 4/9?
If you have a group of 24 marbles and 1/3 of them are blue, how many marbles are blue?
Simplify the fraction 20/60 to its simplest form.
If you have a rectangle divided into 15 equal parts and 4 parts are shaded, what fraction of the rectangle is shaded?
Which of the following fractions is equivalent to 16/32?
If you have a collection of 36 stamps and 3/4 of them are vintage stamps, how many stamps are vintage?
Which of the following fractions is in its simplest form: 10/25, 3/9, 5/15, 7/21?
If you have a rectangle divided into 20 equal parts and 3 parts are shaded, what fraction of the rectangle is shaded?
Which fraction is smaller: 7/15 or 6/14?
If you have a group of 48 pencils and 5/8 of them are red, how many pencils are red?
What is the product of 2/5 and 3/4?
If you have a collection of 80 stickers and 5/8 of them are animal stickers, how many stickers are animal stickers?
What fraction of a rectangle is shaded if 9 out of 36 equal parts are shaded?
If you have a group of 56 toys and 2/7 of them are action figures, how many toys are action figures?
Which of the following fractions is equivalent to 36/72?
If you have a rectangle divided into 25 equal parts and 5 parts are shaded, what fraction of the rectangle is shaded?
What is the sum of 3/8 and 5/12 in its simplest form?
If you have a collection of 64 buttons and 3/4 of them are shiny, how many buttons are shiny?
Which of the following fractions is in its simplest form: 20/40, 7/14, 3/9, 8/24?
If you have a cake divided into 10 equal slices and you eat 3 slices, what fraction of the cake did you eat?
Which of the following fractions is equivalent to 15/30?
If you have a group of 45 sweetsand 2/9 of them are chocolate, how many candies are chocolate?
What is the difference between 7/12 and 3/12?
If you have a rectangle divided into 16 equal parts and 6 parts are shaded, what fraction of the rectangle is shaded?
Which of the following fractions is greater: 9/20 or 10/18?
If you have a collection of 72 beads and 5/6 of them are colorful, how many beads are colorful?
Which of the following fractions is in its simplest form: 24/48, 3/9, 5/15, 1/12?

If you have a group of 56 pencils and 3/7 of them are mechanical pencils, how many pencils are mechanical?
What is the product of 2/3 and 4/5?
If you have a collection of 90 stickers and 2/3 of them are animal stickers, how many stickers are animal stickers?
